div.a: You Can't Say That On The Internet

div.div: A bastion of openness and counterculture, Silicon Valley imagines itself as the un-Chick-fil-A. But its hyper-tolerant facade often masks deeply conservative, outdated norms that digital culture discreetly imposes on billions of technology users worldwide.

div.a: 4Chan Founder Moot Sends Cease & Desist Letter to Startup Moot.It

div.div: 4Chan founder Chris Poole, who has gone by the username Moot since 2003, has sent a cease-and-desist letter to Oregon-based startup Moot.It, a yet-to-launch company that promises to reimagine forums and commenting.

div.div: Eating more chocolate improves a nation's chances of producing Nobel Prize winners - or at least that's what a recent study appears to suggest. But how much chocolate do Nobel laureates eat, and how could any such link be explained?

div.div: NOT THE WORST THAT COULD HAPPEN

div.a: The Brain Disorder That Makes The World Into A Bad Claymation Film

div.div: The eye is just a pinhole that leaks light onto a bunch of reactive cells. It's the brain that "sees" things. And if something goes wrong in the brain, all kinds of things can appear distorted.

div.a: Tiny Stories For Tiny Screens: Tapestry For iPhone

div.div: Tapestry allows anyone to create and share their own iPhone-friendly tappable stories, from the casual creator to prominent writers. Browse stories designed specifically for Tapestry from the likes of New York Times scribes, the Oatmeal, and other best-selling authors. It's the perfect bathroom-reading companion.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U9qn2h&via=Digg&text=Tiny Stories For Tiny Screens: Tapestry For iPhone

div.div: WE DIDN'T KNOW IT WAS A SNUFF FILM

div.a: Up To 27 Animals Killed During The Filming Of 'The Hobbit'

div.div: Animal wranglers involved in the making of "The Hobbit" movie trilogy say the production company is responsible for the deaths of up to 27 animals, largely because they were kept at a farm filled with bluffs, sinkholes and other "death traps.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S98d0k&via=Digg&text=Up To 27 Animals Killed During The Filming Of 'The Hobbit'

div.div: PUT SOME FIG LEAVES ON THAT THING

An exhibition in Vienna probes our attitude towards nudity - people in the West have become accustomed to the naked female form, but male nudes can still shock. Before the show opened, the museum even covered up parts of its own posters, saying they had caused public outrage.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TavnVo&via=Digg&text=The Shock Of The (Male) Nude

div.a: Watch This Page-Scanning Robot Read Faster Than You Could Ever Dream To

div.div: If you're a really fast reader, you can finish off a book in a day, maybe tackle a short one in as little as an hour or two. Good for you but that's nothing compared to the BFS-Auto book-scanning robot.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T9LKlh&via=Digg&text=Watch This Page-Scanning Robot Read Faster Than You Could Ever Dream To

div.a: Opening Titles That Grab Viewers' Attention

div.div: It started with Tony Soprano. To be specific, it started when James Gandolfini, drove through New Jersey during the opening titles of "The Sopranos." Now every show needs an ingenious title sequence.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T7tJ4F&via=Digg&text=Opening Titles That Grab Viewers' Attention

div.div: Until Sunday, the number of Palestinian bystanders killed in the Israeli assault in Gaza may have been as low as 16, barely half the number of fatalities among militants across the first four days. That proportion, if it had stood, would have been exceptional for any war, but is that acceptable?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TMjrW9&via=Digg&text=How Surgical Is A 'Surgical Strike'

div.div: Sean Connery turned down the role of Gandalf in the Lord Of The Rings trilogy, losing out on nearly $450 million dollars, it has been revealed.

div.a: The Real Life Ruins That Became A Bond Villain's Lair

div.div: Once the most densely populated city on earth with a whopping 13,000 people per square kilometer, this island off the coast of southern Japan has been untouched ever since the population vacated in 1974 when coal miningâ€”the source of employment for the islandâ€™s inhabitantsâ€”fell to the wayside.
